title: Change run record markup

labels.name: cmd-run/rerun
labels.description: Issues about the favorite command of ReproPeople

body:
This is not a call for immediate action, but a collection of implications/observation found during the work on #3359 

- there is some desire for some kind of tagging (e.g. "preprocessing") to indicate the purpose of a recorded command (via @yarikoptic )
- #3062 asks for changes in the commit subject line (more free space)
- #3062 also points out that the lines
  ```
     === Do not change lines below ===
     ^^^ Do not change lines above ^^^
  ```
  on which we rely on to be able to load a record (via sidecar or commit message) do not contain an indication that this is actually a run-record.

ATM it seems it would be best to give up any mandatory content in the subject line, and with it remove the implicit suggestion that "RUNCMD" could be used reliably to discover run records. Instead, the actually mandatory lines should be extended to identify them as run records, e.g.:

  ```
     ==CMD= Do not change lines below ===
     ^^CMD^ Do not change lines above ^^^
  ```
or `s/CMD/RUN/g`. With this change it would be as convenient to discover such commit (via `git log`). Moreover, the subject line is now free to include other meaningful tags for human consumption.

Such a change would have minimal transition costs.
